reconfirm verb
(PROVE TRUE)
Add to word list

[ T ] to prove that a belief or an opinion is true: The failure of the book reconfirmed for publishers what they always knew. The team's attitude has reconfirmed my belief that it is the best crew I have ever worked with. Synonym

reconfirm verb
(STATE INTENTION)
[ T ] to state an intention or wish very clearly, for the second time or more: The government has reconfirmed its commitment to increase foreign investment. The manager yesterday reconfirmed his desire to keep the player at the club.
